fr_reason: The US9257711B2 patent aims to improve the efficiency of molten carbonate fuel cells by adjusting hydrogen provided to the anode, thus increasing utilization beyond traditional 70%-75%. In contrast, the US11955674B1 patent focuses on reducing carbon dioxide emissions in hydrocarbon cracking systems during olefin production.
fr_ours: Improves efficiency of molten carbonate fuel cells by adjusting hydrogen provided to the anode, increasing utilization beyond traditional 70%-75%.
fr_competitor: Reduces carbon dioxide emissions in hydrocarbon cracking systems during olefin production by converting methane into electricity.
tu_reason: The US9257711B2 patent recycles hydrogen-rich exhaust back to the anode inlet for increased utilization range of over 10%-30%, with external and internal reforming. The US11955674B1 patent converts methane from the cracking process into electricity using a fuel cell.
tu_ours: Recycles hydrogen-rich exhaust back to the anode inlet for increased utilization range of over 10%-30%, with external and internal reforming.
tu_competitor: Converts methane from the cracking process into electricity using a fuel cell, separating and utilizing the carbon dioxide as a byproduct.
sv_reason: The strategic value of the US9257711B2 lies in increasing energy production and more efficient use of hydrogen, potentially contributing to business success in renewable energy systems. The strategic value of the US11955674B1 is improving environmental performance of hydrocarbon cracking systems, offering potential compliance with stricter emission regulations.
sv_ours: Increases energy production and more efficient use of hydrogen, potentially contributing to business success in renewable energy systems.
sv_competitor: Improves environmental performance of hydrocarbon cracking systems, offering potential compliance with stricter emission regulations.
overall_reason: The US9257711B2 patent offers more direct business benefits, while the US11955674B1 focuses on environmental compliance.

fr_competitor: Removes CO2 from H2-rich gas mixtures, producing high-purity H2 for further use or storage, reducing emissions.

tu_competitor: Uses a pressure swing adsorption (PSA) unit integrated with hydrogen production process to selectively capture CO2.
sv_reason: The EP4469183A1 directly addresses the issue of reducing CO2 emissions, contributing to global warming mitigation and producing a higher purity H2 product, which is more pressing than simply increasing energy production from renewable sources.
sv_ours: Increases energy production and more efficient use of hydrogen, potentially contributing to business success in renewable energy systems.
sv_competitor: Reduces CO2 emissions contributing to mitigating global warming, provides higher purity H2 product.
overall_reason: The EP4469183A1 addresses more immediate and critical concerns related to reducing CO2 emissions and global warming, setting it apart from the US9257711B2.
